executive_summary: Operators in the Charter flight industry provide non-scheduled air transport services for passengers and cargo, which is also referred to as a charter arrangement. Travel may be between private or public airports and may involve regular or irregular service. During this period, the industry faced volatile economic conditions, which reduced demand from passengers traveling for both corporate and leisure purposes. Heightened e-commerce activity amid the pandemic partially insulated the industry from COVID-related declines in 2020. Although the pandemic ultimately hindered revenue, pent-up demand supports a strong recovery for the industry. Overall, industry revenue increased by a CAGR of 0.7% to $30.7 billion over the five years to 2024, including a slight increase of 0.9% in 2024 alone.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Consumers and businesses take advantage of non-scheduled flights to make quick getaways
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The majority of revenue is earned by passenger transport, like chartering business jet aircraft for individuals and business clients, as well as air taxi services. Buyers see value in the flexibility, luxury and convenience non-scheduled flights can offer.

Charter flight operators in the air taxi segment are contending with competition from scheduled air transportation. Traditional airline networks are also expanding to cover underserviced routes, which include charter flight routes.
Broader travel restrictions amid the pandemic significantly hindered air travel of all kinds. In response, charter flights have been turned to cargo transportation, which remained relatively stable.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Swings in Economic Uncertainty are Set to Stagnate Growth
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Charter flights derive demand from several major downstream markets but can be largely boiled down to travelers and freight markets.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Infrastructure Investment Act Boosts Capital Investments in Charter Flights
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act signifies a $1.2 trillion investment in infrastructure, including $550 billion above baseline allocations.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Intensifying competition forces charter flights to differentiate
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Scheduled transportation continues to offer a high number of routes, overlapping those offered by chartered flights at a lower cost.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The pandemic highlights a new competitor
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: While the effects of the pandemic have waned, the halt of air travel at the height of the virus introduced a new competitor.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Recession fears are causing a pullback in discretionary spending
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Technology and innovation will remain pivotal for companies moving forward.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) regulations on the horizon
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The FAA controls the skies through rigorous, strict laws that any airline or charter must follow.

industry_definition: Companies in this industry provide air transport services on an irregular or nonscheduled basis for passengers and cargo, also referred to as a charter arrangement. Industry operators enable people to fly where they want, in terms of destination and airport, and when they want, as opposed to commercial airlines that operate on a fixed schedule of destinations and times.
key_trends: Charter flight operators contend with low-cost alternatives like regional airlines.
Companies differentiate themselves by offering high degrees of comfort and safety.

market_segmentation.segment_description: The international and domestic passenger markets include private consumers and corporate clients.
The international and domestic passenger markets include private consumers and corporate clients.
The international and domestic freight markets consist of freight forwarders, manufacturers, nongovernmental organizations and government agencies.
The international and domestic freight markets consist of freight forwarders, manufacturers, nongovernmental organizations and government agencies.

products_and_services.product_description: The majority of the business is related to Passenger Charter Services.
Cargo Transportation accounts for 19% of the business.
Other Services make up the remaining 8.5%.

tier_1_suppliers: Aircraft Maintenance, Repair & Overhaul in the US
Gasoline & Petroleum Wholesaling in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Iron & Steel Manufacturing in the US
Oil Drilling & Gas Extraction in the US
tier_1_buyers: Freight Forwarding Brokerages & Agencies in the US
Finance and Insurance in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Corporations and large businesses account for much of the revenue.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Economic Uncertainty Makes Passenger Markets Bearish
demand_determinants.determinant_description: The international and domestic passenger markets include private consumers and corporate clients.

business_locations.location_description: The West is home to Alaska, which is highly dependent upon air transportation.
States in the Rocky Mountain draw in charter flight operators.
The States that make up the Southeast region contain the highest concentration of the US population.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The FAA regulates aircraft safety both on the ground and in the air.
The NTSB conducts independent investigations of all civil aviation accidents in the United States.
The EPA regulates operations, including noise abatement, curfews and use of airport facilities.

barriers_points.barrier_description: High competition level which is steady.

basis_points.basis_description: Charter flight operators differentiate themselves by offering high degrees of comfort and safety.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Lean operations enable many small companies to join the industry.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Non-scheduled passenger charter operators use service as a means of competition.
Rent costs consist of fees paid for airport facilities.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: General capital expenses are necessary for operations.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Economic conditions play a big role
volatility_points.volatility_description: General economic uncertainty causes consumers to seek less costly substitutes.
Operating cost fluctuations, particularly in fuel, affect prices for charter services.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Online Platforms Make Booking Less Daunting
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Some charter flights allow customers to book flights using an online booking platform.

FAQs.question: How have pandemic discretionary spending habits affected your major customers?
FAQs.answer: When consumers have more discretionary income, they are more likely to travel.

FAQs.question: How did your company handle changes in industrial, trade and retail activity during the pandemic?
FAQs.answer: Higher levels of cooperation and international trade help us to expand our reach.

FAQs.question: Has your company been exposed to volatile crude oil prices over the past few years?
FAQs.answer: Crude oil is the largest input cost for charter flights.

FAQs.question: Is your company located near large travel hubs?
FAQs.answer: Having a central location is important to maximize traveler access.

FAQs.question: How is your company utilizing new technology, such as telematics and big data analysis software?
FAQs.answer: Programs, such as apps, help us get to know our consumers better.
